summary: This document appears to be an excerpt from a DOJ internal report covering significant developments in the Public Corruption Unit. It specifically notes the indictment and arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell for her role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minor girls, and mentions upcoming trial preparations.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged by a grand jury for her role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minor girls. Arrested and detained, with a trial scheduled.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the individual whose abuse of minor girls was facilitated by Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Maxwell is charged for her role in facilitating Epstein's abuse of minor girls, indicating a conspiratorial relationship in the alleged criminal activity.

events.title: Grand Jury Indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A grand jury returned a six-count indictment charging Ghislaine Maxwell for her role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minor girls.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested at a residence in New Hampshire.

events.title: Scheduled Trial for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Trial for Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled to begin on this date.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was indicted on June 29, 2020, on six counts related to facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minor girls.
Maxwell was arrested on July 2, 2020, at a residence in New Hampshire and has been detained since.
Her trial was scheduled for November 29, 2021, and the prosecution team was in full trial preparation mode in advance of early October deadlines.
The document is part of a DOJ Public Corruption Unit report, indicating the case was tracked within that unit's purview.
